actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Roll Call 510
actions-list.actionItem: Yea and Nay vote pending.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mrs. Ramirez moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 5525.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5525 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed. Bill is closed to amendments.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 741. H.R. 5525 — "Making continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2024, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 742 — "Expressing the profound sorrow of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Dianne Goldman Berman Feinstein."
On approving the Journal Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 218

actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on agreeing to H. Res. 741.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the Honorable Dianne Feinstein.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 741, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.

actions-list.header: On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217

actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 741.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 741 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5525) making continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2024, and for other purposes."
The House resumed with one minute speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed H.R. 5110.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Thompson of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Mr. Thompson (PA) demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Thompson (PA) objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by Head Granthi Giani Jaswinder Singh, Sikh Gurdwara Pine Hill, Pine Hill, New Jersey.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
